content.description:
To investigate bacterial metabolism, a researcher divided a population (culture) of Staphylococcus capitis bacteria into two sets of culture tubes containing glucose. The researcher added a chemical to one set of tubes and measured the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the cultures at <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>-minute intervals as the bacteria metabolized the glucose into lactic acid. The data are shown in Table 1.
 TABLE 1. AVERAGE CHANGE IN <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> IN CONTROL AND TREATMENT GROUPS OVER A <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>-MINUTE PERIOD

content.question: Which of the following best describes the process by which the bacteria are breaking down the glucose to produce lactic acid?

choices.label: The bacteria are breaking down sugars in the absence of oxygen.

The bacteria are creating a <math alttext="H with a plus one charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> gradient to synthesize more <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The bacteria are using their mitochondria to break down glucose in the presence of oxygen.

The bacteria are producing <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the Krebs cycle that is then converted into lactic acid.

content.answer: The bacteria are breaking down sugars in the absence of oxygen.
